direction.raw_text: Use the back way. Avoid the circus. EXT.  POLICE STATION - SIDE DOOR The door opens and Sidney, Tatum, Dewey, and a coupla OFFICERS exit avoiding the horde of REPORTERS that can be seen around the corner waiting anxiously at the front entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll get the car. Wait here. Dewey takes off.  From the darkness of the alley, Gale Weathers appears with Kenny and his camera.  They've been waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Sidney. Sidney spins around to see Gale, standing, smiling at her. Sidney's body tightens and her face goes taut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some night. Are you alright? Their eyes meet in cold familiar stare.  Sidney says nothing. She's visibly shaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not answering any questions. Just leave us alone, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, Tatum. She's just doing her job. Right, GALE?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, that's right. Dewey, in a squad car, turns into the alley and pulls up.  The other news people have wisened up.  They begin to flock the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How's the book?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It'll be out later this year. Sidney tries to contain herself..squeezing a clenched fist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll look for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll send you a copy. In a blurred, unexpected instant, Sidney brings her fist forward, SMASHING it hard into Gale Weathers's face.  The impact sends Gale reeling backwards, knocking into Kenny as they both tumble to the pavement. ON SIDNEY...breathing deep, a sense of satisfaction on her face. INT.  TATUM'S BEDROOM - LATER A spacious bedroom.  Typical.  Tatum and Sidney lay on the bed. They both wear night shirts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I loved it. "I'll send you a copy."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Bitch went down. "I'll send you a copy." BAM! Sid--SuperBitch! Dewey appears in the doorway holding a bag of ice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you might want some ice for that right hook. Sidney sits up, takes the ice, and puts it on her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right next door. Try to get some sleep. Dewey moves back out the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any word on my Dad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to her) Not yet, but we're looking. If you need anything...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... Dewey smiles, pulling the door closed on his way out.  Sidney lies back down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just another sleepover at the Riley's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like old times, ain't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, nothing's like it used to be. Sidney rolls over at her side, away from Tatum. A telephone RINGS somewhere in the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you really think Billy did it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was there, Tatum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew this guy was too perfect. He was destined to have a flaw. A KNOCK at the door.  It opens and a friendly, graying woman pops in.  This is MAMA RILEY.  She wears a comforting smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Telephone, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's for Sid
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Dad? Mama Riley shakes her head sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a message.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright. I'll get it. Sidney takes off out the door.  Mama Riley motions to Tatum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (whispers) How is she? Tatum shrugs. INT.  HALLWAY Sidney grabs the phone at the end of the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from phone) Hello Sidney. IT'S HIM.  The CAMERA does a Hitchcock as Sidney's entire body goes weak..his VOICE moving through her..invading her.  She CRIES OUT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Mama Riley turns in the doorway.  Tatum comes bolting out of the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from phone) Poor Billy-boyfriend. An innocent guy doesn't stand a chance with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like you fingered the wrong guy...again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang up, Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry. You'll find out soon enough. I promise. Mama Riley BEATS on a closed bedroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dewey! Dewey!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is gonna be fun, Sidney. Just like old times. CLICK. Dewey flies out of his room wearing only his boxers...holding his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What? The phone goes dead.  Sidney stands frozen. EXT.  BAYBORO MAIN STREET - DAWN - ESTABLISHING The morning sun shines high over Bayboro Townsquare.  Cars come to life, townsfolk stir as the picture postcard community awakens from a restless sleep. INT.  KITCHEN - MORNING Sidney and Tatum sit at the kitchen table, dressed and ready for school as Mama Riley serves up breakfast.  A small television sits on the counter BLARING. Dewey, in uniform, stands near the door, talking on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you girls really should stay home today.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your objection is duly noted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd rather be around a lot of people, Mama Riley. From the TV, Sidney hears her name, "SIDNEY PRESCOTT..."  All eyes go to the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on TV) ..who escaped a vicious attack last night was the daughter of Maureen Prescott who was brutally killed last year when convicted murderer Cotton Weary... INSERT of COTTON WEARY, in prison fatigues.  A once handsome man, now haggard and worn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) ..broke into their home and savagely raped and tortured the deceased. Cotton Weary is currently awaiting appeal for the death sentence handed down after the young Sidney testified against him. She was the key witness in the state's prosecution...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's never gonna stop. Is it? Dewey is off the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Billy was released. His cellular bill was clean. He didn't make those calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody called me, Dewey. I'm not making it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. We're checking every cellular account in the county. Any calls made to you or Casey Becker are being cross- referenced. It's gonna take time but we'll find him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my Dad? Any word on him? Riley shakes his head "no". EXT.  SCHOOL STREET - LATER Once again, REPORTERS line the street attacking students as they make their way to school, asking questions, hungry for that teenage insight. Dewey's patrol jeep cruises by.  Sidney watches from the passenger's window. INT.  PATROL CAR Dewey pulls up in front of the school.  Tatum hops out while Sid lingers, suddenly unsure.  Dewey takes notice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's school. You'll be safe here. Sidney forces herself out of the jeep as a microphone is shoved in her face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How does it feel to almost be brutally murdered? Dewey leaps from the car, intercepting the reporter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave the girl alone, will ya? She wants to go to school. Sidney eyes the newsvan that's pulled up behind her.  The side door slides open and Gale Weathers steps out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just a sec...I need to talk to someone. She heads over to Gale. EXT.  NEWSVAN - STREET Sidney, puts her head down, hiding her face...avoiding other reporters as she makes her way to... Gale who sits in the open door, checking her face in a mirror. Makeup tries hard to hide Sid's handwork-a swollen black and blue right cheek. Gale spots Sidney immediately and leaps to her feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop right there. Sidney throws her hands up in surrender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not here to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just stay back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling into the van) Kenny. Camera. Now. Kenny's head darts out from the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Off the record. No cameras.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. Sidney contains herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please. You owe me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I owe you shit. Gale moves inside the van.  But Sidney is relentless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You owe my mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother's murder was last year's hottest court case. Somebody was gonna write a book about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And it had to be you with all your lies and bullshit theories.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is your problem? You got what you wanted. Cotton Weary is in jail. They're gonna gas him. A book is not gonna change that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you still think he's innocent? Gale's interest is peaked.  She eyes Sidney suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was convicted in a court of law. Your testimony put him away. It doesn't matter what I think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During the trial, you did all those stories about me. You called me a liar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you falsely identified him. Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you talked to Cotton?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Many times.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has his story changed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not one word. He admits to having sex with your mother but that's all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying. She wouldn't have touched him. He raped her, then butchered her. Her blood was all over his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was drunk that night. He left his coat at your house, after your mother seduced him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw him leaving wearing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But couldn't it have been someone else you saw wearing that coat? The same person who planted it in Cotton's car, framing him? The same person who really killed your mother? A long beat.  Sidney considers this for the millionth time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Cotton murdered my mother. But there's doubt in her voice.  Gale's face lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not so sure anymore, are you? Sidney clams up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it was Cotton. Tatum comes waltzing up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to GALE) Nice welt. Gale ignores her, zeroing in on Sidney, half realizing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The killer is still on the loose, isn't he? These murders are related.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yo--let's rock. Sidney starts to fidget.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry I mangled your face. She take off with Tatum.  Gale calls after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait, Sidney, don't go... But Sidney and Tatum have already disappeared in the crowd of students moving across campus. Gale looks to Kenny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ! An innocent man on death row. A killer still on the loose. Kenny, tell me I'm dreaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want to go live? Gale's mind races with possibilities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not so fast. We have nothing concrete.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did that ever stop you? You can't sit on this. This is huge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I'm gonna blow this up-I need hard proof.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it's so much easier when we make it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not this time. I owe Cotton that much. Hell, even I thought that man was guilty. EXT.  SCHOOL CAMPUS - SECONDS LATER Tatum and Sidney make their way across campus.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just relax. You're at school now. No one can get you here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if it wasn't Billy it could be anybody. He could be here at school right now. They move up the walk as a FIGURE falls in step behind them, sporting a WHITE GHOST MASK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serial killers are smart by definition. They minimize their risk. They plan and pre-calculate everything. Showing up here would be the most lame-brain move he could make.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He promised me he'd be back. As easy as the figure appeared, it disappears-falling out of site, unseen by either of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't put too much stock in a psycho's promise. They move up the front steps toward the main doors of the school as the GHOST MASKED FIGURE reappears...standing at the top of the steps...Sidney sees it first, stopping dead in her tracks. She steps back, spinning around to find... A GHOST FACE behind her as well, both of them approaching, closing in on her.  Sidney starts to SCREAM when the two ghosts bust up LAUGHING, tearing off across campus. EXT.  STREET In front of the school we catch up a REPORTER doing a live remote. He holds a mask in his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This morning several students, in what appears to be a prank, have been spotted wearing masks. School officials have yet to comment but this is the same type of mask worn by the killer... INT. HALLWAY - MINUTES LATER Just before the bell.  The hallway is congested with students heading to class.  Tatum is at her locker with Sidney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a mistake. I shouldn't be here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to meet me here right after class, okay? Billy appears in the crowd, with Stu tagging behind.  Tatum spots him first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit, what is he doing here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet he's pissed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just ignore him. You had good reason to think what you did. Billy and Stu approach.  Billy's face is solemn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, Sid. Can we talk a sec? Sidney says nothing.  She can barely look at him.  Tatum intervenes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know if I were accused of carving up two people, I'd take the opportunity to skip school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, go easy, Tatum. He didn't do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Talk to me, Sid. Suddenly, a SCREAM erupts.  All eyes go to a GHOST MASKED STUDENT running down the hall, screaming wildly, running amuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are they doing this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding? This is like Christmas. Billy punches Stu in the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owwww...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You open your mouth and stupidity pours out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Sidney, clearly upset, takes off down the hall.  Billy races off after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yelling) Stay away from her, Billy. Tatum SLAMS her locker door shut as the bell RINGS. INT.  CORRIDOR - SECONDS LATER With first period underway, the halls have cleared.  One or two struggling students can be seen rushing to class. Sidney moves quickly down the hall, rounding a corner, running smack into... BILLY They collide hard catching Sidney off guard, scaring the life out of her.  She falls backwards, but Billy catches her fall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus, SHIT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, hey, it's just me. Sidney pulls away from him quickly.  Billy feels the slight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? You don't still think it's me? Sidney catches her breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...I don't...it's just...Oh God, Billy, someone was there, someone tried to kill me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police say I scared him off. It wasn't me, Sid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. He called again last night at Tatum's house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See, it couldn't have been me. I was in jail, remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry...please understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Understand what? That I got a girlfriend who would rather accuse me of being a psychopathic killer than touch me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that's not true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then what is it? Is there somebody else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it the sex thing? Am I being too pushy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, it's me, Billy. I need time. I'm still adjusting to my mom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's been a year since she died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (correcting him) Tomorrow. One year tomorrow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When are you gonna let that go, Sid? When my mom left my dad--I just accepted it. This is the way it is. She's not coming back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sharply) Your parents split up. It's not the same thing. Your mom left town, she's not in a coffin somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to move on, Sid. Sidney starts to walk away but turns back, angry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm glad to know you're coping so well with life, Billy. But some of us aren't so perfect. Some of us are just trying to hold on. Sidney disappears through a door marked GIRL'S BATHROOM, leaving Billy alone in the hallway.  He SMACKS his forehead, pissed at himself. INT.  GIRL'S BATHROOM Large and spacious.  Closed bathroom stalls line one wall facing a row of sinks and a huge mirror.  Sidney enters as TWO GIRLS tinkle and talk--each from their respective stalls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 She was never attacked. I think she made it all up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Why would she lie about it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 For attention. The girl has some serious issues. Sidney listens intently. A toilet FLUSHES.  Sidney quickly jumps in a stall, hiding, just as GIRL #1 appears from a stall.  She looks like that voice--a snotty little twit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 What if she did it? What if Sidney killed Casey and Steve?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 And why would she do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Maybe she was hot for Steve and killed them both in a jealous rage. Another toilet FLUSHES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Why would Sidney want to be with Steve? She has her own bubble-butt boyfriend Billy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Maybe she's a slut just like her mom. INSIDE THE STALL Sidney listens.  Her face weakening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 You're evil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Please, it's common knowledge. Her mother was a trollop. GIRL #2 appears from her stall--another twit.  They both stand in front of the mirror adjusting two snotty faces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Cut some slack. She watched her mom get butchered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 And it fucked her up royally. Think about it. It makes perfect sense. Her mom's death leaves her distraught and hostile at a cruel and inhumane world, she's disillusioned, where's God, etc. Completely suicidal. And one day she snaps. She wants to kill herself but realizes teen suicide is out this year. And homicide is a much healthier therapeutic expression. From the stall, Sidney listens, her heart pounding, jaw quivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Where do you get this shit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Ricki Lake. The two girls exit.  Sidney moves out of the stall, catching her reflection in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pathetic. Water DRIPS somewhere from a leaky pipe as wind WHISTLES in from the cracked transom above the bathroom door.  It sound almost like a whisper,   "Siddneey..." Sidney spins around.  What the...  She checks out the bathroom. The doors to the stalls are all closed.  She bends down and scans beneath them, looking for feet.  No one.  Nothing. Sidney turns back to the mirror.  Suddenly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (o.c. whisper) Siddneey... Unmistakable this time.  The VOICE strikes Sidney like a nail through the eye.  It comes from one of the stalls.  She stands thunderstruck, eyeing the stalls thru the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is someone there? A long, morose silence.  And then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (softly, simply) It's me, Sidney. Sidney spins around.  Fuck no!  HE'S HERE.  Terror floods her face.  She eyes the exit door, then the row of stalls she must pass to get to it. She checks under the stalls again.  Nothing...where the fuck is he?  She takes a step forward when... TWO FEET step down from a toilet onto the floor in the last stall. Sidney's face draws tight as the stall door begins to CREAK open. She bolts forward, making a break for it...but slips on the wet floor...her feet flying out from under... Sidney reaches out...grabs hold of a sink...saves herself from falling...she glimpses a GHOST MASK in the mirror coming for her. A hand grabs her shoulder as she SLAMS her body through the exit door...narrowly escaping. INT.  CORRIDOR - CONTINUOUS Sidney flies out of the bathroom door SCREAMING...burning up the hallway, not looking back.  A TEACHER, hearing her SCREAM, peer out from an open doorway...as Sidney sprints by him, not stopping...running madly. INT.  PRINCIPAL'S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS CLOSE on a red-faced Principal Himbry as he reads someone the riot act. MR. HIMBRY I'm sickened. Your whole havoc-inducing, thieving, whoring generation disgusts me. The CAMERA SWINGS AROUND to reveal two GHOST MASKED STUDENTS standing at attention.  Mr. Himbry rips the mask off of one of the student's heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIMBRY Two students have been savagely murdered. And this is how we express our compassion and sensivity? He rips the mask off the other student.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIMBRY We throw on a mask and dance around campus just hoping someone else gets butchered before we get bored again. You're both expelled. The GHOSTS doth protest...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Aw, come on, Mr. Himbry, it was just a joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Yeah, that's not fair. A deep rooted hostility has taken over Mr. Himbry's face.  Neither student budges, scared to even breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIMBRY No, it's not fair. Fairness would be to rip your insides out and hang you from a tree so you can be exposed for the desensitized, heartless little shits that you are. Suddenly the door BURSTS open and Sidney appears, hysterical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (crying) He's here...I saw him...he's here... Mr. Himbry rushes to her, arms outstretched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIMBRY Easy child. Sidney collapses in his arms. EXT.  SCHOOL STREET - MINUTES LATER Dewey's patrol jeep is parked in front of the school.  He stands in the open driver's door talking on the radio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (from radio) She's okay. Looks like some boys were teasing her. Himbry's shutting down the school though. I want you to take look around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir, sheriff. Dewey shuts the jeep door and heads for campus when Gale Weathers appears, her fake face aglow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! Gale Weathers. Field Correspondent,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know who you are, ma'am. How's the eye?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Productive. So they're closing down the school?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well..uh...yes ma'am. For the time being. Dewey heads for the school building. Gale scurries along side him flirtatiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And why is that? Has something happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not supposed to be here, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know, I should be in New York covering the Sharon Stone stalker but who knew? Please, call me Gale. You look awfully young to be a police officer. Dewey's eyes wander down to Gale's long legs, the way her hips move as she walks...he's clearly distracted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm twenty-five years old, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty-five, huh? In a demographic study I proved to be most popular amongst males, 11-24. I just missed you. Of course, you don't look a day over twelve, except in the upper torso area. Does the force require that you work out? Dewey looks away, blushing a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, ma'am. Because of my boyish good looks, muscle mass has increased my acceptance as a serious police officer. They approach the school's front entrance.  Suddenly, Mr. Himbry's VOICE in amplified through intercoms across campus via the PA system.  They stop to listen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HIMBRY (via PA) "Your attention please. Due to the recent events that have occurred and until it comes to a resolve--effective immediately--all classes are suspended til further notice. The Bayboro Police Dept. has also asked me to announce a city wide curfew beginning at 6 o'clock
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I repeat..." Gale speaks over Mr. Himbry's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, you people sure do make fuss over a serial killer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Serial killer is not really accurate, ma'am. The killer has yet to strike twice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, we can hope, can't we? We certainly don't have any leads. A ghost mask, a cellular phone--not much there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're tracking the cellular phone bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? You small town guys are good. And have you located Sidney's father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not a suspect, is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We haven't ruled out that possibil... Dewey, realizing he's said too much, clams up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you'll excuse me, ma'am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Am I keeping you? I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's quite alright. If I may say so, ma'am, you're much prettier in person. Dewey starts up the school's front steps as the bell RINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you do watch the show? He turns to her earnestly as STUDENTS come pouring out the front doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just turned 25. I was 24 for a whole year.

He steps out into the outer office determined to catch a prankster. INT.  OUTER OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Completely empty.  Mr. Himbry moves through the outer office and into the school corridor.  The overhead lights have been turned off and the corridor is now dark and deserted.  He looks up and down the hall.  Only a JANITOR is seen in the distance pushing a broom.

direction.raw_text: . HIMBRY Little shits. Mr. Himbry returns to his office. INT.  OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Himbry reenters his office, moving to his desk, when he spots the closet door NOW CLOSED SHUT. This gives him a pause-he had left it open.  Hadn't he?  Suddenly, he can't remember.  He shifts uneasy, reaching for the door knob, pulling the door open to reveal... AN EMPTY CLOSET.  He stands still a moment, suddenly realizing someone could easily now be standing behind the open closet door. Nervously, he pushes it shut to reveal... NOTHING.  Himbry shakes away his jitters, realizing he's spooked himself.  He continues to his desk, pushing his office door shut when... A GHOST MASKED FIGURE lunges from behind it...knife in hand. Quick and easy.  Three quick jabs to the stomach and Himbry goes down.  The GHOST MASKED FIGURE towering above him. EXT.
